Package renderer.scene.primitives

Class Face

java.lang.Object
renderer.scene.primitives.Primitive
renderer.scene.primitives.OrientablePrimitive
renderer.scene.primitives.Face
public class Face extends OrientablePrimitive
A Face object has a list of integers that represent the endpoints of a closed loop of line segments. The integers are indices into the Vertex list of a Model object.

A Face is closed loop of line segments that is assumed to be "flat" and "convex".

Flat means that the vertices of the Face all lie in the same plane.

Convex means that a line segment joining any two vertices of the Face must be completely contained inside of the Face.

The combination of flat and convex means that we can give a Face an orientation and we can determine if the Face if "front facing" or "back facing".

  • Constructor Details

    • Face

      public Face()
      Construct an empty Face.

    • Face

      public Face(int... indices)
      Construct a Face with the given array of indices for the Vertex and Color index lists.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Primitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      indices - array of Vertex and Color indices to place in this Face

    • Face

      public Face(List<Integer> vIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList)
      Construct a Face object using the two given Lists of integer indices.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Primitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      vIndexList - List of integer indices into a Vertex list
      cIndexList - List of integer indices into a Color list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if vIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if vIndexList and cIndexList are not the same size

    • Face

      public Face(List<Integer> vIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList, List<Integer> cIndexList2)
      Construct a Face object using the three given Lists of integer indices.

      NOTE: This constructor does not put any Vertex or Color objects into this Primitive's Model object. This constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this Primitive gets rendered).

      Parameters:
      vIndexList - List of integer indices into a Vertex list
      cIndexList - List of integer indices into a Color list
      cIndexList2 - List of integer indices into a Color list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if vIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList is null
      NullPointerException - if cIndexList2 is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of any one of the index lists is not 3
